channel.title: Getting Annoyed with noob issue
channel.description:
Alright here is my issue. I run the server and it says:
[code]The system cannot find the path specified. The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Now before im told to go and look for a tutorial on setting up environmental variables. I've done this, and then redone these tutorials on this site, another, and youtube. None of these tutorials solved my issue.
My current Class path's are set as: [code]CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_25\bin;%CLASSPATH%;[/code] My Path's are set as: [code]C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_25\bin;[/code]
I have also tried my jre7 in place of jdk1.7.0_25. I have tried not playing \bin(;) after them, and nothing has worked. Please help.
I am currently using Matrix 718 client I am also using Interception by Tehpk for a source. I am using these because i want a fairy basic hi res source that can support a few users. I will be using these privately for a group of friends.

item.title: Getting Annoyed with noob issue
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You’re missing your cache

Read full topic

item.title: Getting Annoyed with noob issue
item.dc:creator: @XxicemanxX XxicemanxX
item.description:
@XxicemanxX wrote:

[Launcher] Loading Cache... Exception in thread "main" java.io.FileNotFoundException: data\cache\main_file_c ache.dat2 (The system cannot find the path specified) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open(Native Method) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(RandomAccessFile.java:233) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(RandomAccessFile.java:118) at com.alex.store.Store.<init>(Store.java:34) at com.alex.store.Store.<init>(Store.java:28) at com.alex.store.Store.<init>(Store.java:24) at com.rs.cache.Cache.init(Cache.java:20) at com.rs.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:57) Press any key to continue . . .

I got this after working on it some more.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting Annoyed with noob issue
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You just changed from using your run bat to your compiler bat. Stick to one

Also, you’re getting that error because there are no java files listed for the compiler to work with.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting Annoyed with noob issue
item.dc:creator: @XxicemanxX XxicemanxX
item.description:
@XxicemanxX wrote:

How would i do this? Like this?

@echo off title My First Server "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_25\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

cause when i do this i get another error.
this one says:

javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options

Read full topic

item.title: Getting Annoyed with noob issue
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well you could try to change the run.bat so it looks for your java in the C:\ drive instead of using class path.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting Annoyed with noob issue
item.dc:creator: @XxicemanxX XxicemanxX
item.description:
@XxicemanxX wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Well, no. Your classpath is set to x86, which is what you downloaded.

I should probably mention that i have port-forwarded and everything. Do you maybe have an idea of what it could be?

Read full topic

item.title: Getting Annoyed with noob issue
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well, no. Your classpath is set to x86, which is what you downloaded.

item.dc:creator: @XxicemanxX XxicemanxX
item.description:
@XxicemanxX wrote:

I think i did the X86 one. Should i have done x64?

item.title: Getting Annoyed with noob issue
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Did you download the 64 bit version of JDK or the 32 (x86) bit one?

item.title: Getting Annoyed with noob issue
item.dc:creator: @XxicemanxX XxicemanxX
item.description:
@XxicemanxX wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:5, topic:522781”][quote author=XxicemanxX link=topic=641276.msg4320430#msg4320430 date=1372153788]
Sorry for not mentioning it, but i did install them already they are up to date. I said in my post however that i did follow several guides.

Sk8rdude what do you mean by bat code? Sorry i am new at this.
[/quote]
That little thing you click to run the server? Usually title “run-server” or “run”
Yeah, that.[/quote]

Server: Interception By Tehpk

@echo off @title RUN MATRIX java -XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow -server -cp bin;data/libs/netty-3.5.2.Final.jar;data/libs/FileStore.jar com.rs.Launcher false false true pause

Client: Matrix 718

@echo off @title Client "C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe" -Dfile.encoding=Cp1252 -classpath bin;lib/libs.jar;lib/graphics.jar; Loader pause

Also i have Teamviewer if that’d help.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting Annoyed with noob issue
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

.;CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_13\bin;%CLASSPATH%;C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\lib\ext\QTJava.zip

That’s my classpath, I mean, if you’d like to try it.

Also, post your bat code.

Read full topic
